Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.time

Class Time

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.time.BaseTime<Time>
com.telenav.kivakit.core.time.Time
All Implemented Interfaces:
DoubleQuantizable, Quantizable, Stringable, StringSource, PointInTime<Time,Duration>, TimeMeasurement, Comparable<PointInTime<?,?>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalTime
public class Time extends BaseTime<Time>
An immutable Time class that represents a specific point in UNIX time. The underlying representation is a long value which holds a number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 0:00 GMT. To represent a duration of time, such as "6 seconds", use the Duration class. To represent a time period with a start and end time, use the TimeSpan class.
Since:
1.2.6
Author:
Jonathan Locke

    • untilNow

      public Duration untilNow()
      Retrieves the Duration from now to this Time value. If this Time value is in the past, then the Duration returned will be negative. Otherwise, it will be duration from now to this Time .
      Returns:
      the Duration from now to this Time value
